intro: Toxocarpus scortechinii, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Toxocarpus scortechinii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
